p: The antifungal effect of C. longa essential oil has been tested in other Aspergillus spp., such as A. flavus, a common contaminant of cereals, legumes, juices, and fresh and dried fruits [ 182, 204, 205, 206, 207, 208], as well as one of the major source of aflatoxins in agricultural crops, considered the most problematic mycotoxins worldwide [ 181, 209, 210]. The growth rate of A. flavus was significantly reduced with only 0.10% v/v of C. longa rhizome oil (33.2% ar-turmerone, 23.5% α-turmerone and 22.7% β-turmerone). Furthermore, the germination and sporulation were completely inhibited at 0.5% v/v [ 211] ( Table 3).
